page.title: 18BROADWAY LIBRARY
page.content: {Broadway Library}is in Leamington Road and is funded by money from the Rates. It is manned by a full-time librarian and an assistant who works 13 hours per week. The library first opened in 1924 in the old school with just sixty books.It moved into new premises on 14th February 1980. It has a pleasant light atmosphere, with tables and comfortable chairs where people can talk quietly with friends, consult the reference books and read the newspapers and periodicals. On the main roof is a small structure which houses the old fire bell, once used by Broadway's horse-drawn fire engine. A total of 13,776 books are available including 457 reference books. There are also 224 Ordnance Survey Maps.The library has 1692 adult and 409 junior members.Six books were lost this year.
